[[div class="notice"]]
++++ NOTICE FROM THE FOUNDATION
++++ DEPARTMENT OF MISCOMMUNICATIONS

The Department of Miscommunications (DoMc) is to handle all documentation and communication involving Dr. Michaels and follow a strict set of rules. These rules are impossible to state explicitly; however, we have designed this document in a way that heavily implies them.

--Eli Forkley, Director, DoMc
[[/div]]
----
**DOMC NOTICE:** This file requires non-anomalous comprehensive inoculation.

|| **COMMUNICABILITY INDEX:** For adherence to the DoMc personnel Code of Linguistic Integrity, the information contained herein is [[span class="lie"]]100% accurate and readily communicable[[/span]] through textual, pictorial, visual, audial, and subliminal means. Questionable personnel are to proceed to the Site-96 Medical Wing for the administration of Class-A Veritants,[[footnote]]An agent used to verify the existence of a specific memory within a subject.[[/footnote]] and if necessary, subsequent administration of [[[updated-amnestics-guide#toc4|Class-C Amnestics]]]. ||

----
**Special Containment Procedures:** [[span class="lie"]]Dr. Michaels is not in danger.[[/span]] The personal well-being of Dr. Michaels is to be ensured. To this end, Dr. Michaels is kept at Site-96 and is not permitted to interact with personnel unless they are directly involved in his research and containment.

A custodial team will follow Dr. Michaels throughout the day and sanitize the area after he leaves. No member of this staff is permitted to discuss their duties or the situations surrounding them.
----
**Description:** Doctor Jeremy Feldson Michaels is a non-anomalous human male of British-Indian descent, currently employed as a Level-3 Researcher at Site-96. Dr. Michaels is 33 years of age and has worked for the Foundation for 8 years. He is unmarried and an only child, with no immediate family aside from his parents.

[[div class="lite-heading"]]
----
++ ADDENDA MATERIALS
----
[[/div]]

= **I. Personal Safety Assessment Battery**

@@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]
+++ VIDEO LOG
----
**DATE:** 2019/10/20

**TIME:** 08:16 UTC

**FOREWORD:** Dr. Michaels is an asset to the Foundation because of his competencies in the fields of linguistics and miscommunications. The use of a Personal Safety Assessment Battery (or PSAB) is necessary to identify risks to his personal well-being. Designated personnel conducted the PSAB inside a locked containment chamber [[span class="lie"]]to identify issues with Dr. Michaels' mental health.[[/span]]
----
= **[BEGIN LOG]**
----
[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-block
|name=dr-michaels.png
|caption=A recent image of Dr. Michaels. Immediate surroundings redacted.
]]

**Interviewer:** Okay, so just tell me your name -- as is protocol -- and we'll start. How does that sound?

**Dr. Michaels:** @@[@@//He takes a deep breath.//@@]@@ Okay, my name is Doctor Jeremy Feldson Michaels.

**Interviewer:** Perfect, now–

@@[@@//Interviewer glances above Dr. Michaels' head and shifts in their seat.//@@]@@

**Interviewer:** Um, sorry. So anyway, you checked in with the Site Psychiatrist yesterday. Now, this is meant to be a sort of follow-up to your visit. Could you tell me about how it went?

**Michaels:** Yes, well, I've been a bit foggy for the past little while now. You know how that is -- we all get that way when we're stationed away from our families, right?

**Interviewer:** Hmm, could you be more specific? How does this “fogginess” manifest?

**Michaels:** I have a constant looming feeling that I can't get out of my head. Like something just won't let go. [[span class="lie"]]I am speaking metaphorically, of course.[[/span]]

**Interviewer:** Can you tell me roughly when this feeling began?

**Michaels:** I would say right after we lost D-4428-3. Like, within seconds.

**Interviewer:** @@[@@//They write on a notepad.//@@]@@ Right, okay, so you had a traumatic experience.

**Michaels:** [[span class="lie"]]It was something like that.[[/span]]

**Interviewer:** This particular D-Class was part of your personal research team. Am I correct in stating that?

**Michaels:** You are.

**Interviewer:** Who else was on the team?

**Michaels:** Well, [[span class="lie"]]in no particular order[[/span]], that would be Agent Rosewood,[[footnote]]Deceased as of 2019-10-12 @ 19:48 UTC.[[/footnote]] D-4428-1,[[footnote]]Deceased as of 2019-10-12 @ 23:57 UTC.[[/footnote]]
D-4428-2,[[footnote]]Deceased as of 2019-10-13 @ 01:44 UTC.[[/footnote]] Containment Engineer Howard Winters,[[footnote]]Deceased as of 2019-10-13 @ 09:51 UTC.[[/footnote]] and Researcher Gabi Kalpana.[[footnote]]Deceased as of 2019-10-14 @ 20:38 UTC.[[/footnote]]

**Interviewer:** I see. So Jeremy, would you say these feelings are recurring?

**Michaels:** [[span class="lie"]]No.[[/span]] Well, it comes and goes. Sometimes it pulls me down harder than I expect.

**Interviewer:** All right. Your files say your family has no history of traumatic experiences -- ah, [[span class="lie"]]except for your brother[[/span]]. Do you have a brother, Jeremy?

**Michaels:** [[span class="lie"]]I do have a brother, yes.[[/span]]

**Interviewer:** The doctor referred to [[span class="lie"]]him[[/span]] as a “stressor”. Could you explain? What happened to [[span class="lie"]]him[[/span]]?

**Michaels:** [[span class="lie"]]Well, I couldn't tell you where he is now. It's not that I don't know. It's that I would rather not bring him up.[[/span]]

**Interviewer:** Correct me if I'm wrong... [[span class="lie"]]Your brother was a source of hostility toward you.[[/span]]

**Michaels:** [[span class="lie"]]He was an arsehole, sure, but with him, it was more insidious than that. My parents took him in when he was a kid. He's been my foster brother ever since, and we did get along fairly well. When we were growing up, though, something inside him snapped. After that, all he ever did was weigh our family down.[[/span]]

**Interviewer:** And that's when he was hostile?

**Michaels:** [[span class="lie"]]He wasn't confrontational -- it wasn't like that -- it was as if he was a dead weight on all of us, but especially on me. We grew up together, after all, and he was the most attached to me. When I went off to university, though, he– Well, he wouldn't let me go.[[/span]]

**Interviewer:** The doctor's notes say you called [[span class="lie"]]him[[/span]] a– What was it? You called [[span class="lie"]]him[[/span]] “a parasite”.

**Michaels:** @@[@@//He tenses up for a moment, and then sighs and regains his composure.//@@]@@ I wanted to be on my own, that’s all. [[span class="lie"]]But when I was getting moved in, weeks after last seeing him, he was just //there//. I was hundreds of miles away, but he was there somehow. He's done this to other people, too.[[/span]] I– [[span class="lie"]]We[[/span]] weren't the first.

**Interviewer:** Gotcha. @@[@@//They flip through their notepad.//@@]@@ Now, Jeremy, what is your favorite color?

**Michaels:** Pur– No, wait, maybe we can just skip that one.

**Interviewer:** Are– Uh, you sure?

**Michaels:** Go to the next question. Please.

**Interviewer:** @@[@@//They pause, putting a hand up to their ear, hidden from the recording device.//@@]@@ Actually, Dr. Michaels, you were here for the sewage backup, were you not?

@@[@@//Dr. Michaels nods.//@@]@@

**Interviewer:** I [[span class="lie"]]recently[[/span]] got a report that they found the source of that, actually. One of the security personnel -- they found a //huge// pipe burst in one of the abandoned basement sub-levels. It was an absolute flood down there. [[span class="lie"]]Nobody is sure of the cause, though.[[/span]]

**Michaels:** Just now?

**Interviewer:** No, it was about a week ago now. They sent down a task force and lost one in the muck, and when they came back to look for them, it was as if they were incapacitated. They were fine, but they moved too slowly.

**Michaels:** Okay.

**Interviewer:** @@[@@//They inhale sharply and lean forward in their chair.//@@]@@ The task force said they felt fogginess, as you did.

**Michaels:** Did they, now? Huh, [[span class="lie"]]how coincidental.[[/span]]

**Interviewer:** Indeed.
----
= **[END LOG]**
[[/div]]
----
= **II. Final Note**

@@ @@

[[div class="report-box"]]
+++ RESEARCHER NOTE
----
I have tried making myself perfectly clear in this document. [[span class="lie"]]I am completely fine[[/span]], though I don't know how much more of this I can take. Please, if you are reading this, and you understand [[span class="lie"]]nothing is wrong[[/span]]: This can't keep up much longer. One of these days, someone might slip up, or even me, and... I can't do that to myself, or my family, or my fellow personnel. Miscommunications is doing wonders, and it's a miracle they've been able to get me through this, but there's only so much they can handle.

Ultimately? [[span class="lie"]]I am okay[[/span]], you understand? Please, please understand, and find some way to figure this all out.
----

  [[row]]
    [[cell style="width: 70%;"]]
    [[/cell]]
    [[cell style="width: 30%;"]]
//Dr. Jeremy Michaels//
//Site-96 Researcher//
2019/10/20
